intro: Fagara lunu-ankenda, commonly known as the "moonlight tree," is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, and its roots are often used in traditional medicine. Fagara lunu-ankenda is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
